abstract: The recent Good to Go show at the Bowery Poetry Club was a mishmash of performance types.
snippet: The recent Good to Go show at the Bowery Poetry Club was a mishmash of performance types.
lead_paragraph: The recent Good to Go show at the Bowery Poetry Club was a mishmash of performance types. The evening's host, the Canadian comedy star and television personality Sabrina Jalees, kept the audience entertained with hilarious in-character stand-up sketches, and Ben Lerman, an unassuming guy with a ukulele, sang an unexpectedly gripping story about being Ben Lerman - and playing the ukulele. The show was peppered with original choreography from the Good to Go Girls - Jessy Smith, Molly Merkler and Jillian Hollis (shown here) - a bubbly trio of classically trained dancers whose skits toyed with physical comedy and burlesque. All in all, it was a surprisingly professional and well-curated event from one of downtown's few remaining homes for the obscure.

headline.main: Notes From the Underground | Good to Go
